Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I was challenged in this course to really sit down and draw for the first time and in doing so my love for drawing and my ability to articulate space on the page increased tremendously.

1) I improved my drawing skills
2) I learned about drawing as an "essay" by developing ideas in drawings
3) I learned to select particular aspects of drawings/sites that I want to emphasize and thus making my drawing tell a story
I believe that after taking this class my drawing skills have really improved. This course helped me understand the different techniques used with charcoal and pencil.

I developed a love of architecture. I was able to engage with drawing in a different way than I was used to. In this drawing class, I learned technical things about the architectural process. Along with these things, I gained a new appreciation for the architectural buildings and features around Yale's campus.

Definitely strengthened by not doing so many assignments like in the past. I do wish we had spent less time in the beginning fussing over the plan and section drawings and more time developing the expressive drawings like the bundle assignment.

Strengths: 
1) Every class was held in a different venue (different places around Yale), which made the class very engaging and learned me to appreciate Yale architecture better
2) A lot of attention to students and personalized feedback
3) Opportunity to learn from others
4) Focus on ideas in drawings, rather than the mechanics of image-making
The assignments are one of the biggest strengths of this course. They were always interesting, with a level of expectation that challenged the students in the course.

If you are interested in architecture, this course can be a helpful step along the way to getting to really appreciate drawing more. You don't have to take it to be successful, but is a good use of time and a good way to practice more.
I would highly recommend taking this course, since it was one of my favorite courses taken at Yale so far
I would recommend this to another student because the course is different than any other course I have taken. It is a very interesting ad fun class to take that will surprisingly challenge you.
Yes, it has many benefits. It is challenging at times, but yields great results if you embrace the difficulty.
